blog_title: The Great War: A Comprehensive Look at World War I

tasks.title: Introduction: The Dawn of a Global Conflict
tasks.description: Write an engaging introduction that sets the historical context for World War I, highlighting its unprecedented scale and impact. Briefly touch upon the major powers involved and the general timeline.

tasks.title: The Spark and the Powder Keg: Causes of World War I
tasks.description: Detail the complex web of causes, including imperialism, militarism, nationalism, the system of alliances (Triple Entente and Triple Alliance), and the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand as the immediate trigger.

tasks.title: From Trench Warfare to New Technologies: Key Phases and Battles
tasks.description: Explore the major fronts and significant battles (e.g., Marne, Somme, Verdun), the development of trench warfare, and the introduction of new technologies like chemical weapons, tanks, and aircraft. Discuss the stalemate and the human cost.

tasks.title: Life on the Front and the Home Front: A Society Transformed
tasks.description: Describe the experiences of soldiers in the trenches and the profound changes on the home front, including the role of women, rationing, propaganda, and the economic and social mobilization of nations.

tasks.title: The End of the War and Its Lingering Shadow: Aftermath and Legacy
tasks.description: Cover the entry of the United States, the collapse of empires, the armistice, and the Treaty of Versailles. Discuss the short-term and long-term consequences, including the formation of the League of Nations and the seeds sown for future conflicts.
